intro: Leichhardtia clamboides, commonly known as the broad-leaved leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal or semi-arid regions. It is often found in open woodlands and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Leichhardtia clamboides is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
